#wwd_total_m3_descr: Total volume discharged and reused effluent
#wwd_total_m3_expla: Total volume discharged and reused effluent
#wwt_GHG_tre_n2o_descr: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions from treatment process correction factor
#wwt_GHG_tre_n2o_expla: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions from treatment process correction factor: can be positive or negative. If you have country-specific or site-specific emission factors from actual measurements, you can calculate the emissions based on these factors and then using the correction factor, either add or subtract the difference between your emissions and those calculated by ECAM based on the IPCC generic emission factor. The emissions calculated by ECAM will automatically be updated based on the value you enter to correct the emissions.

#wsd_SL_GHG_nrw_expla: GHG in Distribution due to water losses
#wst_SL_GHG_nrw_descr: GHG in Treatment due to water losses
#wst_SL_GHG_nrw_expla: GHG in Treatment due to water losses

Note: the emissions above have not been subtracted in the totals presented in the GHG emissions summary

#wst_treatment_perf: Do you want to evaluate treatment performance
#wwd_water_reuse: Do you want to evaluate GHG emissions avoided from reusing water and nutrients
#wwd_wr_N_rec_expla: Total Nitrogen recovered from ww treatment and/or water reuse, and displacing fertilizer use
#wwd_wr_P_rec_expla: Total Phosphorus recovered from ww treatment and/or water reuse, and displacing fertilizer use
#wwd_wr_adnrg_expla: Additional energy consumption for reuse treatment and/or pumping

#wwd_wr_vol_d_expla: Volume of reused water displacing potable water
#wwt_wr_C_seq_slu_descr: GHG emissions avoided due to carbon sequestration from biosolids management

#wwd_wr_GHG_avo_P_descr: GHG emissions avoided due to Phosphorus recovery

#wwd_wr_nrg_sav_expla: Net electricity savings due to reuse displacing potable water

#ww_KPI_GHG_unt_expla: GHG emissions in CO<sub>2</sub> eq from untreated wastewater
#ww_SL_ghg_unc_ch4_expla: CH<sub>4</sub> from uncollected wastewater. 0.3 is kgCH<sub>4</sub>/kgBOD
#ww_untr_pop_descr: Population whose wastewater is collected but not treated
#ww_untr_pop_expla: Population whose wastewater is collected but not treated
#ww_uncl_pop_descr: Population whose wastewater is not collected
#ww_uncl_pop_expla: Population whose wastewater is not collected
#Activated Sludge - Minor poorly aerated: Activated Sludge - Minor poorly aerated zones
#Days_expla: Period of time adopted for the assessment of the data and of the PI
#Energy performance and Service Level in: Energy performance and Service Level indicators
#This is the highest Energy consumption: This is the highest Energy consumption of your system
#This is the highest GHG emission of you: This is the highest GHG emission of your system
#This value is the sum of all substages: This value is the sum of all substages. Click here to scroll to substages
#TotalGHG_descr: Total GHG emitted during the Assessment period for all stages
#TotalGHG_expla: Total GHG emitted during the Assessment period for all stages (Water stages + Wastewater stages)
#TotalNRG_descr: Total energy consumed during the Assessment period for all stages
#TotalNRG_expla: Total energy consumed during the Assessment period for all stages (Water stages + Wastewater stages)
#Water injected to distribution: Water injected to distribution (=system input volume)
#Years_expla: Period of time adopted for the assessment of the data and of the PI
#You can export individual stages to exc: You can export individual stages to excel using this menu
#assess_your_utility: Assess your utility's carbon footprint, energy consumption and service levels
#birds_stage_not_active: Stage not active. Go to Configuration to activate it.
#bod_pday_expla: This represents the average Biochemical oxygen demand (BOD<sub>5</sub>) that each resident connected to the sewer system eliminates in the wastewater produced every day. The default value is provided after selection of country. This default value shall be adjusted if local studies provide more accurate estimates. The default values provided by the tool are based on the IPCC data, which typically represent the country average. Hence, due to the variability between different areas within a country, it is recommended to use actual measured values for the system whenever possible to obtain the most accurate results.
#c_wsd_nrg_mini_descr: Minimum required energy for the system to operate by users (theoretical)
#c_wsd_nrg_mini_expla: This energy takes into account the node consumption elevation plus the minimum pressure required by the users
#c_wsd_nrg_natu_descr: Natural energy provided (gravity energy from supply to distribution)
#c_wsd_nrg_natu_expla: Sum of natural energy provided for all the input reservoirs and tanks of the stage. Intermediate tanks are not considered.
#c_wsd_nrg_supp_descr: Total supplied energy to the network (natural plus shaft), real system
#c_wsd_nrg_supp_expla: The energy provided to a system can be natural and shaft (pumping energy). With the provided expression the energy is precisely calculated
#c_wsd_nrg_topo_descr: Topographic energy supplied to the system
#c_wsd_nrg_topo_expla: This is the energy supplied to the system because its irregular topography
#wwt_biog_fla_expla: Biogas flared is calculated with the difference between biogas produced minus biogas valorised. If biogas produced is 0 (unknown), biogas flared is estimated using ww_serv_pop*bod_pday*ct_bod_kg*ct_biog_g*Days/1000
#c_wwt_bod_rmvd_expla: This is calculated from the difference in BOD mass from the influent with BOD mass from the effluent over the assessment period.
#c_wwt_ch4_pot_expla: Maximum methane emission potential for sludge stored
#c_wwt_nrg_biog_descr: Total energy content of biogas valorized
#c_wwt_nrg_biog_expla: Sum of energy content of biogas used in a cogenerator or a boiler during the assessment period by all wastewater treatment plants managed by the undertaking
#configuration_active_stages_error: There are no active stages. Click on the table to activate some.
#configuration_subtitle: Select the stages which form your system
#content_C_expla: Mass of carbon C that is contained in the sludge
#content_N_expla: Mass of nitrogen N that is contained in the sludge
#conv_kwh_co2_expla: Ratio of CO<sub>2</sub> emission per energy consumed
#do_you_have_engines: Do you have fuel engines in any stage?
#ecam_by_iwa_giz_icra: ECAM by IWA and GIZ, implemented by ICRA for WaCCliM Project* is licensed under a
#export_explanation: Click on a stage to view its variables. Then, click on 'Highlight the whole table' to copy and paste to an empty Excel file, or click on 'create a csv file'.
#first_time_using_ecam: First time using ECAM?  Click on 'New' or learn more
#for_further_details_go_to_detailed: For further details on energy consumption & opportunities to reduce GHG emissions go to
#fuelInfo_description: Depending on the fuel you select, the following emission factors (EF) will be applied in the equations
#fuelInfo_eeff: Emission Factors (EF), Fuel Density (FD), and Net Calorific Values (NCV) for different fuel types (IPCC, 2006)
#gwp_title_table: Global Warming Potential for 100 year time horizon
#gwp_values_relative_to: GWP values relative to CO<sub>2</sub> for a 100 year time horizon
#index_chrome_warning: Please use Google Chrome. It is not optimized for other browsers.
#index_description: The Energy Performance and Carbon Emissions Assessment and Monitoring Tool is designed for assessing the carbon emissions of the urban water cycle that are within the operational boundaries of water and wastewater utilities and prepare these utilities for future reporting needs on climate mitigation.
#initial_estimation_description: Estimation of GHG emissions at system-wide level
#level3_click_to_modify_the_name: Click here to modify the name
#level3_error_cannot_delete_last_substag: You can not delete the last substage
#level3_error_memory_full: Substage not added: memory is full
#move_the_mouse: Move the mouse over the emissions to get a detailed view at each stage
#navbar_title: Energy performance and Carbon emissions Assessment and Monitoring Tool
#prot_con_expla: Protein consumption per capita per year. The default value is provided after selection of country. If you have a specific factor that applies to your region you can provide. The default values provided by the tool are based on the FAO Statistics Division, which typically represent the country average. Hence, due to the variability between different areas within a country, it is recommended to use actual measured values for the system whenever possible to obtain the most accurate results.
#questions_variables_hidden: Variables hidden if answer is No
#reduction per 1 percent change of curre:
reduction
per 1% change
of current value
#summary_of_estimations_at_this_level: Summary of estimations at this level
#tool_developed_as_part_of_the: tool developed as part of the
#unfccc_5B: Waste - Biological Treatment of Solid Waste
#variable_this_equation_contains_estimat: This equation contains estimated data in at least one input
#variable_this_input_is_considered_estim: This input is considered estimated data by the user
#wacclim_is_part_of_IKI: * WaCCliM project is part of the International Climate Initiative (IKI). The German Federal Ministry for the Environment, Nature Conservation, Building and Nuclear Safety (BMUB) supports this initiative on the basis of a decision adopted by the German Bundestag.
#ws_KPI_GHG_elec_expla: GHG emissions from electricity consumption in all stages of urban drinking water system
#ws_KPI_GHG_expla: GHG emissions from non-electricity and electricity consumption
#ws_SL_auth_con_descr: Authorized consumption per person per day
#ws_SL_auth_con_expla: Volume of authorized consumption per serviced person in the service area managed by the undertaking divided by the duration of the assessment period
#ws_SL_nrg_cost_expla: Proportion of the utility energy costs referred to the total running costs related to urban drinking water system
#ws_nrg_cons_expla: Total energy consumed from the grid for the entire water supply utility, based on the electricity bill during the entire assessment period
#ws_nrg_cost_expla: Costs from electric energy consumption for the entire water supply utility, based on the electricity bill during the entire assessment period
#ws_resi_pop_expla: Number of permanent residents within the water utility area of service
#ws_run_cost_expla: Total operations and maintenance net costs and internal manpower net costs (i.e. not including the capitalised cost of self constructed assets) related to water supply within the service area managed by the undertaking during the entire assessment period
#ws_serv_pop_expla: Serviced population is referred to the number of inhabitants, within the area of service managed by the utility, which are connected to the distribution system and are receiving the service
#wsa_KPI_ghg_estm_red_descr: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wsa_KPI_ghg_estm_red_expla: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wsa_KPI_nrg_cons_new_descr: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wsa_KPI_nrg_cons_new_expla: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wsa_KPI_std_nrg_newp_descr: Estimated standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wsa_KPI_std_nrg_newp_expla: Estimated standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wsa_KPI_un_head_loss_expla: Unit energy friction loss in the conveyance system
#wsa_main_len_expla: Total transmission and distribution mains length (there are not service connections at the abstraction and conveyance stage)
#wsa_nrg_cons_expla: Electric energy consumption including both from the grid and self-produced, for the water abstraction unit, by the undertaking during the entire assessment period
#wsa_pmp_exff_descr: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wsa_pmp_exff_expla: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wsa_pmp_head_expla: Head at which the water is pumped in each water abstraction unit that are the responsibility of the undertaking, during the assessment period
#wsa_pumping: Do you want to evaluate pumping efficiency
#wsa_pumping_eff: Do you want to evaluate electromechanical efficiency of pump
#wsa_vol_conv_expla: Sum of the volume of water abstracted (gravity or pumped) in the water abstraction unit that are the responsibility of the undertaking, during the assessment period
#wsa_vol_pump_expla: Volume of water pumped in each water abstraction unit that are the responsibility of the undertaking, during the assessment period
#wsd_KPI_ghg_estm_red_descr: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wsd_KPI_ghg_estm_red_expla: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wsd_KPI_nrg_cons_new_descr: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wsd_KPI_nrg_cons_new_expla: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wsd_KPI_nrg_efficien_expla: Integrate all system distribution inefficiencies (pumps, friction, leaks and others). Compliments, giving a more complete information dE3
#wsd_KPI_nrg_per_m3_expla: Unit energy consumption per authorized consumption in water distribution
#wsd_KPI_nrg_per_vd_descr: Energy consumption per volume injected to distribution
#wsd_KPI_nrg_per_vd_expla: Unit energy consumption per water injected to distribution
#wsd_KPI_nrg_topgraph_expla: Percentage of energy provided to the system due to the terrain topography
#wsd_KPI_std_nrg_cons_expla: Energy consumption per pumping water per head
#wsd_KPI_std_nrg_newp_descr: Standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wsd_KPI_std_nrg_newp_expla: Standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wsd_KPI_un_head_loss_expla: Unit energy friction loss in the conveyance system
#wsd_KPI_water_losses_descr: Non revenue water per mains length
#wsd_KPI_water_losses_expla: Total water losses (apparent and real), expressed in terms of annual volume lost per mains length
#wsd_SL_cont_sup_expla: Percentage of delivery points (one per service connection) that receive and are likely to receive adequate pressure
#wsd_SL_ghg_attr_descr: Total GHG attributable to water losses
#wsd_SL_ghg_attr_expla: Total GHG attributable to water losses
#wsd_SL_nr_water_expla:
Non revenue water includes: water losses + unbilled authorized consumption.
See non revenue water table
#wsd_SL_pres_ade_expla: Percentage of delivery points (one per service connection) that receive and are likely to receive adequate pressure
#wsd_SL_water_loss_expla:
Water losses include: unauthorized consumption + Customer meter inaccuracies and data handling errors + leakage in transmission and distribution mains + storage leaks and overflows from water storage tanks + service connections leaks up to the meter.
See non revenue water table
#wsd_auth_con_expla: Sum of the volume of metered and/or non-metered water that, during the assessment period, is taken by registered customers, by the water supplier itself, or by others who are implicitly or explicitly authorised to do so by the water supplier, for residential, commercial, industrial or public purposes. It includes water exported
#wsd_av_no_el_expla: The average elevation of the network. If necessary it could be calculated as sum of lowest and the highest node elevation of the network divided by two, for each water distribution unit
#wsd_bill_con_expla: Authorized consumption which are billed and generate revenue (also known as revenue water). It is equal to billed metered consumption plus Billed Unmetered Consumption
#wsd_deli_pts_expla: Number of delivery points that receive and are likely to receive pressure equal to or above the guaranteed or declared target level at the peak demand hour (but not when demand is abnormal).
#wsd_hi_no_el_expla: Is the elevation of the highest node of the network, for each water distribution unit
#wsd_lo_no_el_descr: Lowest node elevation of the stage
#wsd_lo_no_el_expla: Is the elevation of the lowest node of the stage, for each water distribution unit
#wsd_main_len_expla: Total transmission and distribution mains length (service connections not included), for each water distribution unit at the reference date
#wsd_min_pres_descr: Minimum pressure to be supplied at the distribution nodes
#wsd_min_pres_expla: According the standards, a minimum pressure must be provided to the consumers (20 - 30 m) , for each water distribution unit
#wsd_nrg_cons_expla: Electric energy consumption including both from the grid and self-produced, for water distribution during the entire assessment period
#wsd_pmp_exff_descr: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wsd_pmp_exff_expla: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wsd_pumping: Do you want to evaluate pumping efficiency
#wsd_pumping_eff: Do you want to evaluate electromechanical efficiency of pump
#wsd_ser_cons_expla: Total number of service connections, at the reference date
#wsd_service_perf: Do you want to evaluate distribution service performance
#wsd_time_pre_expla: Amount of time of the year the system is pressurised
#wsd_topographic: Do you want to investigate topographic energy
#wsd_trucks: Do you have distribution by 'water trucks'
#wsd_vol_dist_descr: Volume of water injected to distribution
#wsd_vol_dist_expla: The water volume entering the distribution system from the water treatment or directly from abstraction during the assessment period
#wsd_vol_pump_expla: Volume of water in the drinking water distribution system which requires pumping, for each distribution unit
#wsd_water_eff: Do you want to evaluate water efficiency
#wsd_wt_el_no_expla: It is the elevation of the water table to calculate the natural energy provided to the system, for each water distribution unit
#wst_KPI_nrg_per_m3_expla: Unit energy consumption per treated water in water treatment plants
#wst_KPI_slu_per_m3_expla: Unit sludge production per treated water in water treatment plants
#wst_KPI_tst_carr_descr: Percent of quality tests in compliance
#wst_KPI_tst_carr_expla: Percent of quality tests in compliance
#wst_mass_slu_expla: Sludge produced during the assessment period by each urban water treatment plant managed by the undertaking
#wst_nrg_cons_expla: Energy consumed during the assessment period by each urban water treatment plant managed by the undertaking
#wst_pumping_eff: Do you want to evaluate pump efficiency
#wst_trea_cap_expla: The treatment capacity of each WTP or on site system facility that are the responsibility of the wastewater undertaking, during the assessment period
#wst_tst_carr_descr: Percent of quality tests in compliance
#wst_tst_carr_expla: Number of treated water tests carried out during the assessment period
#wst_vol_trea_expla: Sum of the volume of water treated by WTPs that are the responsibility of the water undertaking, during the assessment period
#ww_KPI_GHG_elec_expla: GHG Emissions from electricity consumption in all stages of wastewater system
#ww_KPI_GHG_expla: GHG Emissions from non-electricity and electricity consumption
#ww_SL_nrg_cost_expla: Proportion of the utility energy costs referred to the total running costs
#ww_SL_serv_pop_expla: Percentage of the resident population that are connected to the sewer systems and which wastewater is treated by the undertaking
#ww_SL_treat_m3_expla: Percentage of the collected sewage prior to dilution or overflows in the sewer system that are treated in wastewater treatment plants
#ww_conn_pop_expla: Number of permanent residents within the service area managed by the undertaking which are connected to the sewer system , at the reference date
#ww_n2o_effl_descr: Total Nitrogen load in the effluent
#ww_n2o_effl_expla: Total Nitrogen load in the effluent during the assessment period
#ww_nrg_cons_expla: Total electric energy consumed from the grid related to wastewater management within the service area managed by the undertaking during the entire assessment period
#ww_nrg_cost_expla: Costs from electric energy consumption for the entire wastewater utility, based on the electricity bill during the entire assessment period.
#ww_resi_pop_expla: Number of permanent residents within the area of service for wastewater services managed by the undertaking (whether they are connected or not) , at the reference date
#ww_run_cost_expla: Total operations and maintenance net costs and internal manpower net costs (i.e. not including the capitalised cost of self constructed assets) related to wastewater management within the service area managed by the undertaking during the entire assessment period
#ww_serv_pop_expla: Serviced population is referred to the number of inhabitants (or inhabitant equivalents), within the area of service managed by the utility, which are connected to a sewer system and which wastewater are receiving treatment in a WWTP.
#wwc_KPI_ghg_estm_red_descr: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wwc_KPI_ghg_estm_red_expla: Estimated GHG reduction per assessment period
#wwc_KPI_nrg_cons_new_descr: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wwc_KPI_nrg_cons_new_expla: Energy consumption with expected new pump efficiency
#wwc_KPI_nrg_per_m3_descr: Energy consumption per wastewater conveyed to treatment
#wwc_KPI_nrg_per_m3_expla: Amount of energy consumed to bring 1 m3 of wastewater from the sources to the wastewater treatment plant
#wwc_KPI_std_nrg_cons_expla: Percentage of energy consumed in wastewater collection with regards to the Total energy consumed from the grid and self produced in the water and wastewater systems
#wwc_KPI_std_nrg_newp_descr: Standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wwc_KPI_std_nrg_newp_expla: Standardized energy consumption of new pump
#wwc_KPI_un_head_loss_expla: Unit energy friction loss in the conveyance system
#wwc_SL_GHG_inf_descr: GHG in wastewater collection due to infiltration/inflow
#wwc_SL_GHG_inf_expla: GHG in wastewater collection due to infiltration/inflow
#wwc_SL_fratio_descr: Wet weather flow to dry weather flow ratio
#wwc_SL_fratio_expla: Wet weather flow to dry weather flow ratio
#wwc_SL_inf_emis_descr: Total GHG emissions attributable to infiltration/inflow
#wwc_SL_inf_emis_expla: Total GHG emissions attributable to infiltration/inflow
#wwc_conn_pop_expla: Number of permanent residents within the service area managed by the undertaking which are connected to the sewer system, at the reference date
#wwc_nrg_cons_expla: Energy consumed during the assessment period by each pumping station for conveying wastewater to treatment managed by the undertaking
#wwc_pmp_exff_descr: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wwc_pmp_exff_expla: Expected electromechanical efficiency of new pump
#wwc_pumping: Do you want to evaluate pumping efficiency
#wwc_pumping_eff: Do you want to evaluate electromechanical efficiency of pump
#wwc_rain_day_expla: Number of rain days during the assessment period
#wwc_vol_conv_descr: Volume of wastewater conveyed to treatment
#wwc_vol_conv_expla: Collected wastewater, corresponding to the volume of domestic, commercial and industrial outputs to the sewer system which reaches the treatment plant or an outfall during the assessment period (pumped or not). At sub-stage level, if the volume is pumped, only enter in this line if it is pumping directly to the plant or the discharge. In case of multiple stage pumping do not include the volume in this line. This input should equal value reported in global assessment for volume wastewater treated by default.
#wwc_water_eff: Do you want to evaluate water efficiency
#wwd_KPI_GHG_tre_n2o_descr: Indirect GHG emissions from discharge to water body
#wwd_KPI_GHG_tre_n2o_expla: Indirect CO<sub>2</sub> emitted in receiving waters due to nitrogen in wastewater effluent. Based upon nitrogen in the WWTP effluent multiplied by default emission factor
#wwd_KPI_nrg_per_m3_expla: Unit energy consumption per discharged/reused water
#wwd_KPI_std_nrg_cons_expla: Percentage of energy consumed in wastewater discharged with regards to the Total energy consumed from the grid and self produced in the water and wastewater systems
#wwd_KPI_std_nrg_recv_expla: Unit energy recovered in water discharge
#wwd_SL_GHG_inf_descr: GHG in wastewater discharge/reuse due to infiltration/inflow
#wwd_SL_GHG_inf_expla: GHG in wastewater discharge/reuse due to infiltration/inflow
#wwd_SL_ghg_non_descr: GHG emissions avoided due to water reuse eliminating discharge to receiving waters
#wwd_SL_ghg_non_expla: GHG emissions avoided due to water reuse eliminating discharge to water body
#wwd_n2o_effl_descr: Total Nitrogen concentration in the effluent
#wwd_n2o_effl_expla: Total Nitrogen concentration in the effluent during the assessment period
#wwd_nrg_cons_expla: Sum of energy consumed (from the grid or self-produced) during the assessment period by all each pumping stations for discharged wastewater managed by the undertaking
#wwd_pumping: Do you want to evaluate pumping efficiency
#wwd_trucks: Do you have truck transport for reused water
#wwd_vol_disc_descr: Volume of discharged effluent to water body
#wwd_vol_disc_expla: Volume of wastewater discharged by each wastewater treatment plant that are the responsibility of the undertaking, during the assessment period. This includes all the wastewater collected, whether it is conveyed to treatment or discharged untreated
#wwt_KPI_GHG_dig_fuel_ch4_expla: Amount of CH<sub>4</sub> (CO<sub>2</sub> eq) emissions due to fuel employed for digester
#wwt_KPI_GHG_dig_fuel_co2_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub> emissions due to fuel employed for digester
#wwt_KPI_GHG_dig_fuel_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub> eq emissions due to fuel employed for digester (CO<sub>2</sub>+N<sub>2</sub>O+CH<sub>4</sub>)
#wwt_KPI_GHG_dig_fuel_n2o_expla: Amount of N<sub>2</sub>O (CO<sub>2</sub> eq) emissions due to fuel employed for digester
#wwt_KPI_GHG_fuel_expla: Direct CO<sub>2</sub> emitted from on-site engines in wastewater stages based upon sum of CO<sub>2</sub>, CH<sub>4</sub> and N<sub>2</sub>O emission from stationary combustion
#wwt_KPI_GHG_slu_expla: From sludge management operations (storing, composting, incineration, land application, landfilling, stockpiling and truck transport)
#wwt_KPI_GHG_tre_ch4_expla: Methane (CO<sub>2</sub> eq) emitted in wastewater treatment plants
#wwt_KPI_GHG_tre_n2o_expla:
N2O (CO2 eq) emitted in wastewater treatment plants.
Eq 6.9 2006 IPCC Guidelines for National Greenhouse Gas Inventories
#wwt_KPI_biog_x_bod_expla: Unit energy production per treated wastewater in wastewater treatment plants
#wwt_KPI_capac_util_expla: Percentage of dry weight of sludge that comes out from the WWTP to disposal
#wwt_KPI_dry_sludge_expla: Dry sludge production per treated wastewater in wastewater treatment plants
#wwt_KPI_ghg_app_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to land application of sludge
#wwt_KPI_ghg_app_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to land application of sludge
#wwt_KPI_ghg_comp_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge composted
#wwt_KPI_ghg_comp_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge composted
#wwt_KPI_ghg_inc_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge incineration
#wwt_KPI_ghg_inc_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge incineration
#wwt_KPI_ghg_land_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to landfilling of sludge
#wwt_KPI_ghg_land_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to landfilling of sludge
#wwt_KPI_ghg_sto_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub> eq From sludge storage
#wwt_KPI_ghg_sto_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub> eq emissions related to sludge storage
#wwt_KPI_ghg_stock_co2eq_descr: Total CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge stockpiling
#wwt_KPI_ghg_stock_co2eq_expla: Amount of CO<sub>2</sub>,eq emissions due to sludge stockpiling. Emissions due to stockpiling only refer to the first year
#wwt_KPI_ghg_tsludge_ch4_expla: Indirect CO<sub>2</sub> emitted from sludge transport off-site. Based upon CH<sub>4</sub> emission from mobile combustion. The fuel consumption is calculated assuming 2 times distance to disposal site (round tryp) time the number of trips times an average diesel consumption of 25 L per 100 km
#wwt_KPI_ghg_tsludge_co2_expla: Indirect CO<sub>2</sub> emitted from sludge transport off-site. Based upon CO<sub>2</sub> emission from mobile combustion. The fuel consumption is calculated assuming 2 times distance to disposal site (round tryp) time the number of trips times an average diesel consumption of 25 L per 100 km
#wwt_KPI_ghg_tsludge_expla: Indirect CO<sub>2</sub> emitted from sludge transport off-site. Based upon sum of CO<sub>2</sub>, CH<sub>4</sub> and N<sub>2</sub>O emission from mobile combustion. The fuel consumption is calculated assuming 2 times distance to disposal site (round tryp) time the number of trips times an average diesel consumption of 25 L per 100 km
#wwt_KPI_ghg_tsludge_n2o_expla: Indirect CO<sub>2</sub> emitted from sludge transport off-site. Based upon N<sub>2</sub>O emission from mobile combustion. The fuel consumption is calculated assuming 2 times distance to disposal site (round tryp) time the number of trips times an average diesel consumption of 25 L per 100 km
#wwt_KPI_nrg_biogas_expla: Unit energy consumption per BOD mass removed in wastewater treatment plants
#wwt_KPI_nrg_per_kg_descr: Energy consumption per BOD<sub>5</sub> mass removed
#wwt_KPI_nrg_per_kg_expla: Percentage of energy consumed in wastewater treatment with regards to the Total energy consumed from the grid and self produced in the water and wastewater systems
#wwt_KPI_nrg_per_pump_descr: Energy consumption for wastewater pumping to treatment
#wwt_KPI_nrg_per_pump_expla: Energy consumption for wastewater pumping to treatment
#wwt_KPI_nrg_x_biog_descr: Electrical energy produced per total available energy in biogas
#wwt_KPI_nrg_x_biog_expla: Unit biogas produced per BOD mass removed in wastewater treatment plants
#wwt_SL_GHG_inf_descr: GHG in wastewater treatment due to infiltration/inflow
#wwt_SL_GHG_inf_expla: GHG in wastewater treatment due to infiltration/inflow
#wwt_SL_qual_com_expla: Percentage of water quality tests carried out in wastewater treatment plants that comply with discharge consents
#wwt_SL_vol_pday_descr: Treated wastewater per person per day
#wwt_SL_vol_pday_expla: Volume of treated wastewater per serviced person in the service area managed by the undertaking divided by the duration of the assessment period
#wwt_biog_pro_expla: Biogas produced during the assessment period by each wastewater treatment plant managed by the undertaking
#wwt_biog_val_descr: Biogas valorised as heat and/or electricity
#wwt_biog_val_expla: Biogas valorized in the treatment plant to heat the digesters or the building and/or to run a Co-generator to generate heat and electricity
#wwt_bod_effl_expla: BOD<sub>5</sub> load at the effluent of the WWTP during the assessment period. It can be estimated by multiplying the average BOD<sub>5</sub> concentration in the effluent by the effluent volume the plant. If this is done daily and summed over the duration of the assessment period the value will be most accurate
#wwt_bod_infl_expla: BOD<sub>5</sub> load entering the WWTP during the assessment period. It can be estimated by multiplying the average BOD concentration in the influent by the volume entering the plant. If this is done daily and summed over the duration of the assessment period the value will be most accurate
#wwt_bod_slud_expla: BOD removed from the wastewater though the process of removing primary or secondary sludge from the aerobic treatment process. This value is used to estimate the Methane emissions from poorly aerated biological treatment of wastewater
#wwt_ch4_biog_expla: Percent of the methane content in the produced biogas
#wwt_ch4_efac_expla:
Methane emission factor of selected biological wastewater aerobic treatment processes.
Activated Sludge - Well managed:0
Activated Sludge - Minor poorly aerated zones:0.06
Activated Sludge - Some aerated zones:0.12
Activated Sludge - Not well managed:0.18
Aerated Lagoon: 0.18
Anaerobic Lagoon <2m depth: 0.12
Anaerobic Lagoon >2m depth: 0.48
Anaerobic Lagoon covered: 0.00 //MISSING VALUE
Trickling Filter: 0.036
UASB - CH4 recovery not considered: 0.48
UASB - CH4 recovery considered: 0.0
Wetlands - Surface flow:0.24
Wetlands - Horizontal subsurface flow:0.06
Wetlands - Vertical subsurface flow:0.006
#wwt_composting: SM Is sludge sent to composting
#wwt_dryw_slu_expla: Average of dry total weight of sludge produced as dry weight during the assessment period by each wastewater treatment plant managed by the undertaking. If sludge is processed with centrifuges or chemicals, a good estimation is 20% of Sludge produced in WWTP (total weight)
#wwt_incineration: SM Is sludge sent to incinerate
#wwt_land_application: SM Is sludge sent to land application
#wwt_landfilling: SM Is sludge sent to landfilling
#wwt_mass_slu_app_descr: Sludge sent to land application (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_app_expla: Amount of sludge that is sent to land application (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_comp_expla: Amount of sludge that is sent to composting (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_expla: Sludge produced during the assessment period by each wastewater treatment plant managed by the undertaking
#wwt_mass_slu_inc_expla: Amount of sludge that is sent to incineration (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_land_expla: Amount of sludge that is sent to landfilling (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_sto_expla: Amount of sludge that is stored prior to disposal (dry weight)
#wwt_mass_slu_stock_expla: Amount of sludge that is stockpiled (dry weight)
#wwt_nrg_biog_descr: Electrical energy produced from biogas valorization
#wwt_nrg_biog_expla: Energy produced from biogas valorization during the assessment period by each wastewater treatment plant managed by the undertaking
#wwt_nrg_cons_expla: Total energy consumed during the assessment period by all wastewater treatment plants managed by the undertaking
#wwt_producing_biogas: Are you producing biogas from anaerobic digestion
#wwt_pumping_eff: Do you want to evaluate pump efficiency
#wwt_serv_pop_expla: Serviced population is referred to the number of inhabitants (or inhabitant equivalents), within the area of service managed by the utility, which are connected to a sewer system and which wastewater are receiving treatment in a WWTP.
#wwt_slu_composting_ch4_descr: CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge composting
#wwt_slu_composting_ch4_expla: Amount of CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge composting
#wwt_slu_composting_n2o_descr: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge composted
#wwt_slu_composting_n2o_expla: Amount of N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge composted
#wwt_slu_inciner_ch4_descr: CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge incinerated
#wwt_slu_inciner_ch4_expla: Amount of CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge incinerated
#wwt_slu_inciner_n2o_descr: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge incinerated
#wwt_slu_inciner_n2o_expla: Amount of N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge incinerated
#wwt_slu_landapp_n2o_descr: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge for land application
#wwt_slu_landapp_n2o_expla: Amount of N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge applied to land
#wwt_slu_landfill_ch4_descr: CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge for landfilling
#wwt_slu_landfill_ch4_expla: Amount of CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge applied to landfill
#wwt_slu_landfill_n2o_descr: N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge for landfilling
#wwt_slu_landfill_n2o_expla: Amount of N<sub>2</sub>O emissions due to sludge applied to landfill
#wwt_slu_storage: SM Evaluate sludge storage in WWTP
#wwt_slu_storage_ch4_descr: CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge storage
#wwt_slu_storage_ch4_expla: Amount of CH<sub>4</sub> emissions due to sludge storage
#wwt_soil_typ_expla: Soil typology the sludge is applied on. Note: if you don't know the soil typology, leave it as 'Fine-textured'
#wwt_stockpiling: SM Is sludge sent to stockpiling
#wwt_time_slu_sto_expla: Time interval the sludge is stored for before being sent to disposal
#wwt_trea_cap_expla: Treatment capacity of each WWTP that are the responsibility of the wastewater undertaking, during the assessment period
#wwt_treatment_perf: Do you want to evaluate treatment performance
#wwt_trucks: SM Do you truck transport sludge to disposal site
#wwt_tst_cmpl_descr: Number of water quality tests complying
#wwt_tst_cmpl_expla: Number of tests in each wastewater treatment plant that comply with discharge consents during the assessment period
#wwt_tst_cond_descr: Number of water quality tests conducted
#wwt_tst_cond_expla: Number of tests carried out in each treated wastewater treatment plant during the assessment period
#wwt_vol_trea_expla: Volume of treated wastewater over the assessment period
